sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词均含"肤浅的，浅薄的"之意。
means: superficial ： 通常指人的思想、言论、学识、著作等权停留于表面，缺乏必要的深度和全面性。
shallow ： 指知识、议论、认识或立论肤浅，有时暗示图表面而无实际内容。

word_mean: 浅的，表面的：属于或位于近表面

sentence.Network_en: Father had no more than a superficial knowledge of music.
sentence.Network_cn: 父亲对音乐只懂一点皮毛。

sentence.Network_en: The other injured man had a superficial stomach wound.
sentence.Network_cn: 另一名受伤男子是腹部的皮外伤。

sentence.Network_en: Their arguments do not withstand the most superficial scrutiny.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的论据经不起一点推敲。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin superficialis, from Latin superficies (see superficies)

entry.tran: 肤浅的;浅薄的;粗枝大叶的
entry.def: If you describe someone as superficial, you disapprove of them because they do not think deeply, and have little understanding of anything serious or important.

example.ex: This guy is a superficial yuppie with no intellect whatsoever...
example.tran: 这个家伙是个肤浅的雅皮士，没有什么头脑。

example.ex: The tone of his book is consistently negative, occasionally arrogant, and often superficial.
example.tran: 他的书基调一贯是负面消极的，有时还有点儿傲慢自大，且常常流于肤浅。

entry.tran: (行动、情感、关系)表面的，外表的，不深入的
entry.def: If you describe something such as an action, feeling, or relationship as superficial, you mean that it includes only the simplest and most obvious aspects of that thing, and not those aspects which require more effort to deal with or understand.

example.ex: Their arguments do not withstand the most superficial scrutiny...
example.tran: 他们的论据经不起一点推敲。

example.ex: His roommate had been pleasant on a superficial level...
example.tran: 他的舍友只是表面上装和气。

entry.tran: 表面的，乍看起来的(尤指实际并非如此)
entry.def: Superficial is used to describe the appearance of something or the impression that it gives, especially if its real nature is very different.

example.ex: Despite these superficial resemblances, this is a darker work than her earlier novels...
example.tran: 尽管表面上有一些相似之处，但这本著作实际要比她以前的小说悲观。

example.ex: Spain may well look different but the changes are superficial.
example.tran: 西班牙可能看起来与以前有很大不同，但这些变化都是表面上的。

entry.tran: (伤势或伤害)表层的，表皮的，表面的
entry.def: Superficial injuries are not very serious, and affect only the surface of the body. You can also describe damage to an object as superficial .

example.ex: The 69-year-old clergyman escaped with superficial wounds...
example.tran: 69 岁的牧师幸免于难，只受了点皮肉伤。

example.ex: The explosion caused superficial damage to the fortified house.
example.tran: 这次爆炸只对这所加固过的房屋造成了轻微破坏。

entry.def: The superficial layers of the skin are the ones nearest the surface.

means.word_mean: 1. being or affecting or concerned with a surface; not deep or penetrating emotionally or intellectually;

sentences.sentence: "the superficial report didn't give the true picture"

auth_sentence.content: Some of the arts coverage has been very superficial.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some of the arts coverage has been very superficial.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some of the arts coverage has been very superficial.

auth_sentence.content: I needed to have a more than superficial understanding.
auth_sentence.res_content: I needed to have a more than superficial understanding.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I needed to have a more than superficial understanding.

auth_sentence.content: There's nothing more irritating than superficial information nowadays.
auth_sentence.res_content: There's nothing more irritating than superficial information nowadays.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's nothing more irritating than superficial information nowadays.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"在……上面"; 2. 表示"超级,超过,过度"

stems_affixes.word_buile: super在……上面+fic做+ial……的→在表面上做
super超级,超过,过度+annuated有年纪的→adj.老迈的,老式的
super超级,超过,过度+cili眉毛+ous……的→在眉毛上看人→目中无人
super超级,超过,过度+flu流+ous……的→超过了流出来
super超级,超过,过度+natural自然的→adj.超自然的
super超级,超过,过度+sensitive敏感的→adj.过度敏感的
super超级,超过,过度+sized大小的→adj.超大型的
super超级,超过,过度+sonic音速的→adj.超音速的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 极度的, 极大的, 至高的, 最高的
stems_affixes.word_buile: supre=super超级,超过,过度+eme→adj.极度的, 极大的, 至高的, 最高的
super在……上面+stit建立+ion表名词→建立在人[理智]之上的东西→迷信
super在……上面+structure结构→n.上层建筑
super超级,超过,过度+market市场→n.超级市场
super在……上面+impose放上去→在上面放→强加
super在……上面+intend想要,打算→在上面算计→监督
super在……上面+sede=side坐→坐上去→淘汰[以前的东西]
super在……上面+vis看+e→在上面看→临视
super超级,超过,过度+charge收费,负担→负担过重
super在……上面+fic做+ial……的→在表面上做
efficacy[[n.功效,效能,效力]]男→adj.有效的, 灵验的
fict=fic做,制作+itious……的→做出来的
ef出+fic做,制作+acy状态,结果→做出来的结果→功效
fict=fic做,制作+ion表名词→做出的故事
pro很多+fit=fic做→做很多,做得好→利润

sentences.en: A superficial injury is not serious.

means.word_mean: 肤浅的, 浅薄的; 缺乏深度的,粗略的；粗枝大叶的

sentences.cn: 这是一本立论肤浅的书。

sentences.en: He has a superficial knowledge of this subject.
sentences.cn: 他对这门学科略知皮毛。

sentences.en: You're too superficial to appreciate great literature like this.
sentences.cn: 你太肤浅, 无法欣赏这类文学巨著。

jushi.chinese: 他对这门学科略知皮毛。

jushi.english: A superficial injury is not serious.

jushi.chinese: 这是一本立论肤浅的书。
